<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>We've had a few of them this year, but yesterday was one of those days that zapped us out of our routine and forced us to acknowledge the immense challenges we face as a country—whether it's a pandemic, a massive hurricane, or systemic racial injustice. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It may not be much, but we hope this morning's newsletter gives you the strength and energy to start chipping away at these particular issues, or any other roadblocks you're aiming to overcome. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/nba-players-strike-racial-justice?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
NBA Players Lead Strike for Racial Justice
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Empty basketball court" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjMyL2VtcHR5X2Jhc2tldGJhbGxfY291cnQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ashley Landis-Pool/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s every basketball player’s dream to take the court in the NBA playoffs. But ahead of Game 5 of their first round matchup against the Orlando Magic yesterday, the Milwaukee Bucks decided there were more important issues than basketball—they decided <a href="https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/29747523/three-game-5s-set-wednesday-postponed-bucks-decision-boycott?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not to play</a> to protest a recent police shooting in Kenosha, WI, and larger issues of systemic racial injustice. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Following the Bucks' refusal to play, the NBA announced that all games were postponed for the night. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>All teams in the WNBA and a few in MLB and MLS also decided not to play out of protest. Tennis star Naomi Osaka said she wouldn't compete in her tournament semifinal today. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What they’re calling attention to: </strong>In Kenosha, a city 40 miles south of Milwaukee, a white police officer <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-53917170?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shot Jacob Blake</a>, a Black man, in the back at least seven times on Sunday. Footage of the shooting went viral, sparking protests and violent clashes with police throughout the week. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">As remarkable as this decision is, it’s not out of nowhere</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NBA made racial injustice a <a href="https://frontofficesports.com/sparked-by-bucks-strike-slate-of-nba-playoff-games-postponed/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">focal point</a> in its return, allowing players to put statements supporting social justice on the back of their jerseys and emblazoning the court with the “Black Lives Matter” slogan. But players and coaches increasingly expressed frustration and discomfort with the situation, questioning whether they were only distracting from these issues by playing the season in a “bubble” in Orlando.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I think coming here just took all the focal points off what the issues are,” Bucks guard George Hill said on Monday. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>LA Clippers coach Doc Rivers </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/espn/status/1298476250709635072?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">addressed the incident</a></span><span> in postgame comments on Tuesday, saying “It’s amazing why we keep loving this country, and this country does not love us back.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This historic decision will ripple across sports and all the industries in its orbit, from media to finance. After all, that’s the point. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Watch: </strong>Chris Webber <a href="https://twitter.com/NBAonTNT/status/1298757270608605189?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spoke from the heart</a> on TNT. And here’s the <a href="https://twitter.com/Bucks/status/1298763794986995718?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">full statement</a> from the Bucks players.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEATHER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/26/hurricane-laura-makes-landfall-louisiana-texas-coasts?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hurricane Laura Is Pummeling the Gulf Coast
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Hurricane tweet " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjI4L2h1cnJpY2FuZV90d2VldC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>National Hurricane Center</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hurricane Laura, a massive and "extremely dangerous" Category 4 storm, was expected to <a href="https://www.cnn.com/us/live-news/hurricane-laura-updates/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">make landfall</a> on the Texas and Louisiana coasts early this morning. It's only the eighth Category 4+ storm to hit the Gulf Coast in modern history. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As you can see from the tweet above, the National Hurricane Center warned of an “unsurvivable” storm surge.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Authorities are working to limit the damage: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The American Red Cross said it sent over 600 workers to the states and provided shelter for more than 5,000 people Tuesday night. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Louisiana Coastal Protection and Restoration Authority closed at least 410 floodgates, shut off pumps, and tried to plug gaps in the area’s many waterways. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it means for the economy: </strong>Gulf of Mexico drilling platforms account for as much as 17% of U.S. oil production. Laura is forecast to cause <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-26/laura-to-join-costly-list-of-catastrophic-gulf-coast-hurricanes?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$25 billion in damage</a>—at least $5 billion of that to refineries alone, per Enki Research. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re thinking about all of our readers in the storm’s path. Stay safe.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/26/fed-chair-jerome-powell-set-deliver-big-speech-virtual-economic-policy-symposium?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
“Speeeeeech”—Everyone to Jerome Powell
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Jerome Powell sitting at a desk looking concerned " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjMwL2plcm9tZV9wb3dlbGwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Wong/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last year at the Fed’s economic policy symposium in Jackson Hole, WY, central bankers from around the world huddled up over U.S.-China trade tensions, Trump’s attacks on the Fed, and Brexit.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What about this year?</strong> First of all, no huddling. Second of all, no Teton views—everything is virtual. Third of all, the pandemic has turned things upside down and the entire financial world is looking to Fed Chair Jerome Powell to shepherd the economy back from the brink.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Powell’s giving a big speech today, one of the biggest of his tenure. In his remarks, he’ll provide an update on the two-year review the Fed has been conducting into its monetary policy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One word you’ll hear a lot is “inflation” (when prices rise and purchasing power falls). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Fed has targeted 2% inflation, but we’ve come in below that figure for years. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some analysts suspect the Fed will keep interest rates near zero for </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-26/fed-seen-holding-rates-at-zero-for-five-years-plus-in-new-policy?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">at least five years</a></span><span> to accommodate more inflation. This would be a significant change in strategy.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Where to watch: </strong>The Kansas City Fed’s <a href="https://www.youtube.com/user/KansasCityFed?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">YouTube channel</a> at 9:10am ET.</p>

</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Facebook in the trash" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjMxL2ZhY2Vib29rX2luX3RoZV90cmFzaC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook is peeved at Apple right now, and it’s not because it was forced to listen to an unwanted U2 album. In a blog post yesterday, FB explained how Apple’s upcoming iOS 14 contains a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/26/facebook-apple-ios-14-could-cut-audience-network-revenue-in-half.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">privacy update</a> that will make it much harder for Facebook and lots of smaller companies to collect the user data fueling some of their targeted ad efforts. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let’s talk specifics</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook’s Audience Network business, which allows developers to serve targeted ads to their users using Facebook's data but <em>outside</em> Facebook itself, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-facebook-advertising-apple/facebook-says-apples-new-privacy-rules-could-hurt-smaller-app-companies-idUSKBN25M2BO?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">uses</a> an Apple tool called “identifier for advertisers,” or IDFA. Companies use these identifiers to track user activity across apps. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple’s iOS update will now explicitly ask users to opt in to that sort of tracking, whereas before it was "opt out." Facebook's read the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2009/09/27/business/economy/27view.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">academic literature</a>—it knows opting in is a hurdle most won't climb. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So, will Facebook be hurt? Maybe, but no one is sure how badly considering it doesn’t report how large Audience Network revenue is. Investors are brushing it off; shares gained 8% to a record high. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FITNESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/26/new-jersey-government-announces-reopening-date-gyms?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
There Is a Situation Developing in New Jersey Gyms
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="The Situation working out " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=380 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/1ylunPnZTyjXk40t76/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="The Situation working out " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/1ylunPnZTyjXk40t76/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A New Jersey government official confirmed that gyms in the state would be <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-26/n-j-gyms-can-operate-in-september-in-major-step-to-reopening?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">allowed to reopen</a> September 1...exactly one day before NYC mayor Bill De Blasio is allowing gyms to resume operations <a href="https://www.timeout.com/newyork/news/nyc-gyms-will-be-allowed-to-open-in-september-082420?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in the city</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why it’s a big deal</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NJ gym owners have been publicly <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/27/new-jersey-gym-owners-arrested-defying-state-health-mandate?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arm-wrestling</a> with Gov. Phil Murphy over restrictions on non-essential businesses since March, saying the mandates infringed on their constitutional rights. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In NYC, it’s chests before tests:</strong></span><span> Gyms are set to open eight days before the proposed start date for schools in the city. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> With gyms closed for months, home fitness boomed. Yesterday, Dick’s Sporting Goods said online sales <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/26/dicks-sporting-goods-dks-reports-q2-2020-earnings-beat.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped 194%</a> in Q2 and same-store sales rose over 20%. And anyone who's used a milk jug as a dumbbell knows that fitness equipment is literally flying off the shelves. “If you’re going to walk in our store, it’s still going to look like our fitness business is really depleted,” CEO Ed Stack said.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other Thursday, we bring you a few of our favorite business-related reads. This week is all about fascinating company histories. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780393652246?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Super Pumped</em></a></span><span><em> </em></span><span>by NYT journalist Mike Isaac spills all the scandalous details of Uber’s ruthless climb to the top and the excesses of Silicon Valley startup culture. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781631493942?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Franchise</em></a></span><span> by Georgetown Prof. Marcia Chatelain examines the legacy of McDonald’s in Black communities in the wake of the civil rights movement. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781250217745?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Bitcoin Billionaires</em></a></span><span> by Ben Mezrich tells the story of how Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, fresh off a contentious settlement with Facebook, heard about bitcoin on a beach in Ibiza then went on to make it big in crypto. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Don’t forget to check out our full list of <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bookshelf recommendations</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjMyL2VtcHR5X2Jhc2tldGJhbGxfY291cnQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAshley Landis-Pool/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s every basketball player’s dream to take the court in the NBA playoffs. But ahead of Game 5 of their first round matchup against the Orlando Magic yesterday, the Milwaukee Bucks decided there were more important issues than basketball—they decided \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/29747523/three-game-5s-set-wednesday-postponed-bucks-decision-boycott?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot to play\u003c/a\u003e to protest a recent police shooting in Kenosha, WI, and larger issues of systemic racial injustice. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFollowing the Bucks' refusal to play, the NBA announced that all games were postponed for the night. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAll teams in the WNBA and a few in MLB and MLS also decided not to play out of protest. Tennis star Naomi Osaka said she wouldn't compete in her tournament semifinal today. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat they’re calling attention to: \u003c/strong\u003eIn Kenosha, a city 40 miles south of Milwaukee, a white police officer \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-53917170?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshot Jacob Blake\u003c/a\u003e, a Black man, in the back at least seven times on Sunday. Footage of the shooting went viral, sparking protests and violent clashes with police throughout the week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAs remarkable as this decision is, it’s not out of nowhere\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe NBA made racial injustice a \u003ca href=\"https://frontofficesports.com/sparked-by-bucks-strike-slate-of-nba-playoff-games-postponed/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efocal point\u003c/a\u003e in its return, allowing players to put statements supporting social justice on the back of their jerseys and emblazoning the court with the “Black Lives Matter” slogan. But players and coaches increasingly expressed frustration and discomfort with the situation, questioning whether they were only distracting from these issues by playing the season in a “bubble” in Orlando.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“I think coming here just took all the focal points off what the issues are,” Bucks guard George Hill said on Monday. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLA Clippers coach Doc Rivers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/espn/status/1298476250709635072?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaddressed the incident\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in postgame comments on Tuesday, saying “It’s amazing why we keep loving this country, and this country does not love us back.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis historic decision will ripple across sports and all the industries in its orbit, from media to finance. After all, that’s the point. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Watch: \u003c/strong\u003eChris Webber \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/NBAonTNT/status/1298757270608605189?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espoke from the heart\u003c/a\u003e on TNT. And here’s the \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/Bucks/status/1298763794986995718?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efull statement\u003c/a\u003e from the Bucks players.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHurricane Laura Is Pummeling the Gulf Coast\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Hurricane tweet \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjI4L2h1cnJpY2FuZV90d2VldC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNational Hurricane Center\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHurricane Laura, a massive and \"extremely dangerous\" Category 4 storm, was expected to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/us/live-news/hurricane-laura-updates/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emake landfall\u003c/a\u003e on the Texas and Louisiana coasts early this morning. It's only the eighth Category 4+ storm to hit the Gulf Coast in modern history. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs you can see from the tweet above, the National Hurricane Center warned of an “unsurvivable” storm surge.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAuthorities are working to limit the damage: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe American Red Cross said it sent over 600 workers to the states and provided shelter for more than 5,000 people Tuesday night. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Louisiana Coastal Protection and Restoration Authority closed at least 410 floodgates, shut off pumps, and tried to plug gaps in the area’s many waterways. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it means for the economy: \u003c/strong\u003eGulf of Mexico drilling platforms account for as much as 17% of U.S. oil production. Laura is forecast to cause \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-26/laura-to-join-costly-list-of-catastrophic-gulf-coast-hurricanes?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$25 billion in damage\u003c/a\u003e—at least $5 billion of that to refineries alone, per Enki Research. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’re thinking about all of our readers in the storm’s path. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast year at the Fed’s economic policy symposium in Jackson Hole, WY, central bankers from around the world huddled up over U.S.-China trade tensions, Trump’s attacks on the Fed, and Brexit.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat about this year?\u003c/strong\u003e First of all, no huddling. Second of all, no Teton views—everything is virtual. Third of all, the pandemic has turned things upside down and the entire financial world is looking to Fed Chair Jerome Powell to shepherd the economy back from the brink.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePowell’s giving a big speech today, one of the biggest of his tenure. In his remarks, he’ll provide an update on the two-year review the Fed has been conducting into its monetary policy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne word you’ll hear a lot is “inflation” (when prices rise and purchasing power falls). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Fed has targeted 2% inflation, but we’ve come in below that figure for years. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSome analysts suspect the Fed will keep interest rates near zero for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-26/fed-seen-holding-rates-at-zero-for-five-years-plus-in-new-policy?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eat least five years\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to accommodate more inflation. This would be a significant change in strategy.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Where to watch: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Kansas City Fed’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/KansasCityFed?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eYouTube channel\u003c/a\u003e at 9:10am ET.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacebook is peeved at Apple right now, and it’s not because it was forced to listen to an unwanted U2 album. In a blog post yesterday, FB explained how Apple’s upcoming iOS 14 contains a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/26/facebook-apple-ios-14-could-cut-audience-network-revenue-in-half.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprivacy update\u003c/a\u003e that will make it much harder for Facebook and lots of smaller companies to collect the user data fueling some of their targeted ad efforts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet’s talk specifics\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacebook’s Audience Network business, which allows developers to serve targeted ads to their users using Facebook's data but \u003cem\u003eoutside\u003c/em\u003e Facebook itself, \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-facebook-advertising-apple/facebook-says-apples-new-privacy-rules-could-hurt-smaller-app-companies-idUSKBN25M2BO?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003euses\u003c/a\u003e an Apple tool called “identifier for advertisers,” or IDFA. Companies use these identifiers to track user activity across apps. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple’s iOS update will now explicitly ask users to opt in to that sort of tracking, whereas before it was \"opt out.\" Facebook's read the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2009/09/27/business/economy/27view.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eacademic literature\u003c/a\u003e—it knows opting in is a hurdle most won't climb. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo, will Facebook be hurt? Maybe, but no one is sure how badly considering it doesn’t report how large Audience Network revenue is. Investors are brushing it off; shares gained 8% to a record high. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
